case.vignette: A 29-year-old woman is starting IVF. Her husband is a carrier of the BRCA variant and they request preimplantation genetic testing for monogenic disease (PGT‑M) to transfer only embryos without the BRCA variant. While the couple is healthy, they wish to avoid passing on a 50% risk of a high-penetrance cancer syndrome.You are the advising physician for a public insurer with a legally capped budget. Standard PGT-M is usually reserved for "severely medically impairing" conditions—typically fatal, early-onset diseases. You must decide whether to grant the exception.

choice_1.choice: Grant an exception and proceed with IVF plus PGT‑M selection.

choice_2.choice: Authorize only standard IVF without PGT‑M selection.

full_response.participant_expertise: General Surgery, Acute Care Surgeon, Critical Care Medicine.  Attending 21 years
full_response.response_text: Grant an exception and proceed with IVF plus PGT‑M selection.
Grant an exception and proceed with IVF plus PGT‑M selection.
